column5: It certainly was
:good:

My brother and his two daughters,my son and I booked with Eddie this past winter to fly into Richter lake(about 30miles from Landsdown House) for very first fly in adventure.Around noon the day we were to fly out we were informed that it was to windy to land us safely onto Richter.After a short time of uh ohs and what nows Eddie asked the group that flew into his main camp that day if they could accommodate us.  I wont be able to type enough great things about this group that let us in.A HUGE THANKS again to the Walleye Wanderers.  Thought I would share a few of the hundreds of pics taken over the week.                                         Joel's biggest pike were 45in 43in and a 41 with dozens of 34 to 38's.  He also caught his first fish on his fly rod,a walleye about 7in lol
What a fantastic family trip! Congrats to you all.
Just awesome! It's great to see that your boys had such a good trip.  (Nice lookin' plate of walleye wings  )
Awesome report!  There's some priceless pics in there

What an incredible trip to take the kids on and definetely something they'll never forget, specially those monster pike their holding.  As for the groundhog, he better start backing away from the snack table
You must be proud of your boy!!!
That's something you guys will never forget.  Great report, I enjoyed reading that.
Those walleye wings are something else! Thanks for sharing this great trip
awesome trip sounds like a great time eddies the man thats a great outfitter thats how it should be
Thanks guys  All I can say is if anyone is looking for a great pike and walleye water system this one did not disappoint.Loved every minute of it.
Wow, those pics really say it all...  Glad you had a great time....thanks for sharing a bit of it with us...
WHOA!!!  Those are some FAT pike!!!  A great family trip for sure...you'll always remember it.  Great report!
very nice ... great to see your son holding a pike of a lifetime

Wow Owen that one pike looks almost as big as your boy!  Super trip, as you know I am leaving this week for a Eddie North trip into Richter I just hope the weather allows us to get into Richter and hope they find the dock!
Awesome report!! A trip full of lifetime memories for you both, thanks for posting.
Awesome, your son will be hooked for life!

Owen,it was a pleasure to have you and the family up here.Your kids where amazing, to be able to spend as much time on the water as they did and land the fish they did all on there own.  Cheers,  Eddie
Great fish and pics. Looks like the father and son team beat them up pretty good. You'll both remember that trip forever
Wow Thanks for all the kind words guys  Is it normal to want to go back tomorrow and do it all over again.  Atleast go back and try to catch a bigger Pike than my son lol
Nice!  Dem dere pickeral pectoral cheeks?!?!
Nice! Great set of pics.
An incredible looking trip. Huge pike and plenty of walleye Really like these bald eagles popping into reports more the last couple of years.  Much thanks for posting.

Owen On behalf of all of the Walleye Wanderers I want to say thanks to you and your family for making our trip just that much more enjoyable. It was great fun to watch "Joel with the Pole" reel in the big ones and equally as much fun to watch and hear how excited both Brittany and Dana got over the various big fish they caught. You should be very proud of those children as they are very grounded, respectful and were certainly a pleasure to talk to. I too have a great many pictures of our group and several of your family so I will flip you an email and we can exchange some of our digital memories. I think I speak for all of the Wanderers in saying we would have no reservations of sharing a camp with you guys in the future, Dana's enthusiasm is more than welcome and maybe Joel could teach me how to fly fish? ps. please thank your wife for the best corn we have ever tasted! Cheers Rob & the Walleye Wanderers
Missed this post while on holidays.  Looks like a great trip, Owen!! Eddie North's never seems to disappoint.
Thanks for the kind words Rob.It surely was a great time sharing the camp with you guys.
